PATIENT_ID: TEST_SPINAL_001
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-02-19 11:00:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-02-19 11:10:00
Category I activation for 35-year-old male. High-speed MVC with rollover.
Blunt trauma mechanism. Complaining of severe midline neck and back pain.
Midline spinal pain documented. Midline tenderness on palpation.
Neurologic deficit present: bilateral lower extremity weakness.
Paresthesia in bilateral feet. Sensory loss below T10.
Spine examination: spinous process step-off palpated at T11.
Motor and sensory examination documented.
BP 88/52, HR 110, RR 22, GCS 15.

[IMAGING] 2026-02-19 11:30:00
CT cervical spine: no acute fracture.
CT thoracic spine: T11 burst fracture with retropulsed fragment.
Spinal fracture identified on CT imaging. Spinal injury confirmed.
CT lumbar spine: no additional fractures.

[NURSING_NOTE] 2026-02-19 11:15:00
Cervical collar applied on arrival. Spinal motion restriction maintained.
C-collar in place. Log-roll precautions.
Rectal tone assessed: decreased.

[PHYSICIAN_NOTE] 2026-02-19 12:00:00
T11 burst fracture with neurologic deficit (motor and sensory).
Spinal cord injury suspected. Neurosurgery consulted.
Cervical collar maintained pending complete evaluation.
MRI spine ordered for further characterization.
